reviews.review_msg: Dr Brown is a good prof, but her multiple choice exam qs are ultra specific.

Worst class I've taken at SFU. Despite doing well, the grade was hard earned. The course material is not hard but the test consisted of very specific multiple choice r, meaning you have to memorize facts from the textbook. Sherri was also rude, moody, and made the course material unnecessarily hard for a 2nd year intro class.
Take this class! Sherri is awesome, and really is willing to go the extra mile to help you!

Great class. Final was hard, and her expectations were high, but she did not penalize heavily for not meeting those expectations so her grading was pretty easy. She is incredibly willing to help, with both her class, your other classes, and your future goals however she can. One of the best professors I've ever had.

Sherri is super nice and knows what she is talking about. The downside is that she marks HARD. There is no midterm for this class, therefore the final is cumulative,  in which she asks the MOST specific questions in which you need to cite the lectures, authors, and date in APA style (not fun). Paper was graded on the stricter side, but was fair.
Very fun, open and helpful professor.  You will have to keep up with the readings if you want to do well, but if you do, the tests are not especially difficult.  Very fair marking for essays as well.

Reading load was very manageable.  However, i have to say that while she is very helpful in giving you tips for your research paper, she tended not to reflect the improvements you make in the grade given.  The final exam was tough.  You had to know small details and while the readings were fairly easy, the exam questions were much tougher.
Lectures are dry and the prof  just regurgitates the readings. But there is clear grading criteria for all projects so at that's a bonus.
I got B- but I have no complaints about it. She was totally fair in grading students' works. No need for too much works but fair amount of works

Sherri is an excellent prof, but you should only take her class if you are willing to be challenged and are willing to put in the work. It is not hard to get an A or a B in her class, but you need to follow her instructions and put in the time and effort. She is extremely helpful, responsive, clear, and informative. One of my favourite profs.
she is an enthusiastic prof. I was a little disappointed when she did not recognize the national flag of India. Other than that, she is decent.

Not a bad prof, out of touch from what she teaches and tests on.  The text was high school level and she used a lot of simple case studies; however, on the exam and essay she expected higher level than what she had been teaching. The whole class received a C, she decided to inform us we all did bad  on the essay moments before we started our final.

A great teacher for communicating tough ideas.  Is also probably 95% responsible for myself taking research journals far more seriously as sources this year. Do your reading and you'll get a good mark.

This Prof pretends to care about you and would offer to read your material but the grades do not correspond with what she has said. She also picks favourites in her class and can be on the 'beechy' side.

I'd reccomend taking this course with another professor as a previous commenter implied. Sherri is completely disorganized and her lectures are lengthy in content and hardly concise to what she tests you on. MT written was fair, but the MCQ for the MT and Final were utter nonsense.  It tested you on if you could regurgitate the txtbook.

One of my favourite professors. The class was very interesting and she is an exceptional speaker. I would take a class with her in the future. The final exam was very difficult, though. Her TA Adam was really cool, too.
